intro: Pipturus polynesicus, commonly known as the Polynesian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Pipturus polynesicus is often found in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
